question:
We've observed various cases of happiness. We find that
taking vitamin C is the only additional factor that occurs
if and only if the person is happy.
So probably taking vitamin C causes happiness.

In comparing two groups, we've found that people
in the first group are bald, but not those in the second.
The two groups are otherwise identical, except that the first group
eats wheat germ but not the second. So probably wheat germ causes
(or is part of the cause of) baldness, or baldness
causes (or is part of the cause of) eating wheat germ.

We've studied a sample of people
who swim and have found that 80 percent
of these people are intelligent. So we conclude
that probably roughly 80 percent of those
who swim are intelligent.

We've discovered that the more that a person
runs the more the person has hiccups.
So probably running causes hiccups,
or having hiccups causes one to run,
or some third thing causes both.

Fernandez and Boyle are alike in most ways.
Fernandez takes vitamin C.
This is all we know about the matter.
So probably Boyle also takes vitamin C.

85 percent of the people who drink coffee
have a cold. Connolly drinks coffee.
So Connolly has a cold.

We've discovered in comparing two groups that people
in the first group have stomach flu, but not those in the second.
The two groups are otherwise identical, except that the first group
eats spinach but not the second. So probably spinach causes
(or is part of the cause of) stomach flu, or stomach flu
causes (or is part of the cause of) eating spinach.

We've observed a large and varied group of people
who do LogiCola. 40 percent of those in our sample
have a cold. So probably roughly 40 percent of those
who do LogiCola have a cold.

You eat spinach but don't have heart attacks. So it's false that
eating spinach necessarily causes heart attacks.

In various examples of obesity, we've found that
everyone who eats wheat germ is obese, and
everyone who is obese eats wheat germ.
So probably eating wheat germ causes obesity,
or obesity causes one to eat wheat germ.

Greene drinks beer and 57 percent of
those who drink beer are bald.
This is all we know about the matter.
So Greene is bald.

The more that you backpack the more you have a cold.
So probably backpacking causes colds.

We've studied a sample of people
who run and have found that 55 percent
of these people are intelligent. So we conclude
that probably roughly 55 percent of those
who run are intelligent.

We've found groups that drink beer but don't have bad breath.
So drinking beer doesn't always cause bad breath.

So probably swimming causes forgetfulness,
